String: Welcome to...
String_di: Bienvenidos a...

String: Diceeeeeeey Duuuuuungeeeeons!
String_di: ¡Diceeeeeeey Duuuuuungeeeeons!

String: The only game show where YOU could|win your heart's greatest desire!
String_di: ¡El único concurso en el que PUEDES|conseguir los anhelos de tu corazón!

String: But will you fulfill your dreams...|or your nightmares?
String_di: Pero ¿serás capaz de hacer realidad tus sueños...|o tus pesadillas?

String: Let's find out with our host for this evening...
String_di: Tendremos como presentadora esta noche...

String: and for eternity...
String_di: y toda la eternidad...

String: it's Lady LUCK!
String_di: ¡a la mismísima Fortuna!

String: Thank you! Thank you all, my dears and my darlings!
String_di: ¡Gracias! ¡Gracias a todos, queridos amigos!

String: And welcome back to my labyrinth of endless terror!
String_di: ¡Y bienvenidos otra vez a mi laberinto de horror infinito!

String: Will our newest contestants win big or lose it all?
String_di: ¿Podrán los nuevos concursantes llevarse|el gran premio o lo perderán todo?

String: Let's find out as we meet...
String_di: ¡Vamos a descubrirlo! Con todos nosotros...

String: ... the Warrior!
String_di: ... ¡el guerrero!

String: Whoa! I'm a dice!
String_di: ¡Hala! ¡Soy un dado!

String: Yes, dear. That's how this works.
String_di: Sí, querido. Así funciona la cosa.

String: Tell me, Warrior, what secret emptiness has driven|you to risk eternal imprisonment at the hands of fate?
String_di: Dime, guerrero: ¿qué vacío existencial te trae|aquí para arriesgarte a la condena sempiterna del destino?

String: ...what?
String_di: ... ¿Cómo?

String: My dear, what are you playing for today?
String_di: Encanto, ¿por qué has venido a jugar?

String: Oh! I'm playing to win a monster truck.
String_di: ¡Ah! Voy a jugar para ganar un monster truck.

String: And to become the strongest man|in the world!
String_di: ¡Y para convertirme en el más fuerte|del mundo!

String: Inspirational!
String_di: ¡Eso sí que es confianza!

String: Well, you know what we say here in Dicey Dungeons.
String_di: Bueno, ya sabes lo que decimos en Dicey Dungeons.

String: Luck might be against you, but it's too|late to change your mind now!
String_di: Puede que la suerte esté en tu contra, pero|¡es demasiado tarde para cambiar de idea!

String: It’s time for another episode of Dicey Dungeons,|with our feisty little fighter, the Warrior!
String_di: Es hora de otro episodio de Dicey Dungeons|con nuestro pequeño luchador peleón, ¡el guerrero!

String: Hey, Lady Luck! I’m doing great, aren’t I?
String_di: ¡Hola, Fortuna! Lo estoy haciendo de miedo, ¿verdad?

String: You sure are!
String_di: ¡Claro que sí!

String: If I keep this up I’ll have that|monster truck in no time!
String_di: ¡Si sigo así, voy a conseguir|el monster truck en un visto y no visto!

String: So determined! And I think you may be right: you|WILL have that monster truck in... “no time”.
String_di: ¡Qué determinación! Creo que quizá tengas razón:|VAS a conseguir tu monster truck en un visto... “y no visto”.

String: Yeah! Wait, what?
String_di: ¡Sí! Un momento, ¿cómo dices?

String: ...it’s a double meaning, you see.|“No time” could also mean “never”.
String_di: ... Es un chistecillo, ¿entiendes?|“No visto”... porque no lo vas a “ver”.

String: Please don’t tell me I need to make this any clearer.
String_di: Por favor, no me digas que tengo que explicarte la gracia.

String: Wait, but I’m doing great! You just said!
String_di: ¡Pero si lo estoy haciendo bien! ¡Me lo acabas de decir!

String: OF COURSE I did, and of course none of us have any reason|to believe that my show isn’t completely fair.
String_di: CLARO que te lo he dicho. Y también está claro que nadie tiene|motivos para creer que mi concurso no es completamente justo.

String: So in you go for another round!
String_di: ¡Venga, a por otra ronda, te toca!

String: Warrior, my love! How are you getting on?
String_di: ¡Guerrero de mi corazón! ¿Cómo va la cosa?

String: You know, if you stop fighting against me and start|working really hard on being a good minion...
String_di: Mira, si dejas de enfrentarte a mí y empiezas a esforzarte|en serio para llegar a ser un buen esbirro...

String: ...then in a couple hundred years you might|have a shot at becoming a level boss.
String_di: ... es posible que en unos tropecientos años tengas|una pequeña oportunidad de convertirte en jefe de nivel.

String: What? No! I’m getting on fine!
String_di: ¿Cómo? ¡No! ¡Ya me las apaño yo bien!

String: I'm going to win this!
String_di: ¡Voy a ganar este concurso!

String: You’re really not, you know.
String_di: La verdad es que no, para que lo sepas.

String: And that's another thing!
String_di: ¡Y déjame que te comente otra cosa!

String: I’m beginning to think you might not|have our best interests at heart!
String_di: Estoy empezando a pensar que puede que no te|preocupe lo que nos pase... ¿Te da igual rompernos el corazón?

String: ...You’re not the smartest of my little battlers, are you?
String_di: ... No eres un lumbreras, ¿verdad, pequeñín?

String: Of course I don't have your best interests at heart.
String_di: Pues claro que no me preocupa romperte el corazón.

String: I don't even have a heart to *theoretically*|have them at in the first place.
String_di: Yo ni siquiera tengo corazón, así que en teoría|no puedo sentir preocupación por ti.

String: But what I do have is... more monsters for|you to fight! In you go!
String_di: Pero lo que sí que tengo son... ¡más monstruos|con los que vas a luchar! ¡Ahí lo llevas!

String: Put your hands together for the next hapless-
String_di: Una ronda de aplausos para el próximo y desventurado-

String: er, HOPEFUL challenger!
String_di: esto... ¡AVENTURADO concursante!

String: He's got big hopes, big dreams...
String_di: Tiene grandes esperanzas, grandes sueños...

String: ...and he signed a legally binding agreement not to sue us!
String_di: ... ¡y ha firmado un contrato de carácter vinculante para no demandarnos!

String: It's... the Thief!
String_di: Con todos vosotros... ¡el ladrón!

String: Wait, you meant that dice thing literally?
String_di: ¡Espera! ¿Lo del dado lo decías en sentido literal?

String: I mean *everything* literally.
String_di: Todo lo que digo siempre es en sentido literal.

String: So tell me, Thief, what brings you to|my arena of terrible fate?
String_di: Bueno, ladrón, cuéntame: ¿qué te|trae a esta arena y a su horrible destino?

String: Okay. A dice.
String_di: Vale. Un dado.

String: Good.
String_di: Bien.

String: Right, well, my friends don't seem to be |taking this seriously, but I am.
String_di: Bueno, mira, parece que mis amigos no se|lo toman en serio, pero yo sí.

String: And I'm going to win a billion dollars.
String_di: Y voy a ganar mil millones de euros.

String: Mmm. And what will you do with the money if you win?
String_di: Mmm. ¿Y qué vas a hacer con el dinero si ganas?

String: Anything I want.
String_di: Lo que quiera.

String: For the rest of my life.
String_di: Durante el resto de mi vida.

String: Well, fortune favours the bold.
String_di: Bueno, la fortuna favorece a los valientes.

String: At least, that's what people who haven't|met me sometimes believe.
String_di: Al menos eso es lo que cree la gente|que no me conoce.

String: Let's get started!
String_di: ¡Empezamos!

String: Welcome back! This episode we’ll be checking in with|our cleverest little cube-boy, the Thief!
String_di: ¡Bienvenidos de nuevo! ¡En este episodio, tenemos a nuestro|cubito más listo, el ladrón!

String: It’ll take more than a few monsters to|keep me from my rightful reward!
String_di: ¡Hará falta algo más que unos cuantos monstruos|para evitar que consiga mi merecida recompensa!

String: It’s lovely that you’re still so confident.
String_di: Sigues muy seguro de ti mismo, qué monada.

String: No doubts?
String_di: ¿No tienes dudas?

String: No creeping fear that you might have risked it all|only to end up trapped here for eternity?
String_di: ¿No tienes un miedo atroz a haberlo arriesgado todo|solo para terminar atrapado aquí por toda la eternidad?

String: Well, I’m very glad to hear it.
String_di: Bueno, me alegra mucho oír eso.

String: I’d wish you luck, but that always seems hypocritical,|given I'm the one handing it out.
String_di: Te desearía suerte, pero eso siempre me parece hipócrita|teniendo en cuenta que yo soy la que la reparte.

String: Off you go!
String_di: ¡Adelante!

String: How are you doing, my dear?
String_di: ¿Qué tal va todo, cariño?

String: You’re the little realist of your group - are you|going to be the first to see sense and give up?
String_di: Eres el más realista de tu grupo... ¿Vas a ser|el primero en razonar un poco y rendirte?

String: It’s not so bad, being a minion - we’ve got a ball pit in the staff|room, and there are free muffins in the kitchen every morning!
String_di: Ser un esbirro no está tan mal: tenemos una piscina de bolas|en la sala de empleados ¡y magdalenas gratis en la cocina cada mañana!

String: None of us are going to give up.
String_di: Ninguno de nosotros va a rendirse.

String: We came to win, and we’re going to do it.
String_di: Hemos venido a ganar y es lo que vamos a hacer.

String: All of us.
String_di: Todos.

String: What a strange time for you to develop a|sense of solidarity, my dear!
String_di: ¡Qué curioso que desarrolles este sentido|de solidaridad justo ahora, querido!

String: Perhaps this will make you reconsider:
String_di: Quizás esto te haga reconsiderarlo:

String: If you give up first, I’ll let you spend a whole|hour outside the Dungeons every year.
String_di: Si eres el primero en rendirte, te dejaré pasar toda|una hora al año fuera de las mazmorras.

String: That'll make your eternal imprisonment|sting even more sweetly.
String_di: Eso hará que el dolor de tu reclusión eterna|sea todavía más dulce.

String: ...that’s not even a good offer!|That’s a terrible offer!
String_di: ... ¡Eso ni siquiera es una buena oferta!|¡Es una oferta terrible!

String: Also: no!
String_di: Y además... ¡No!

String: Oh, it's definitely a dreadful offer!
String_di: ¡Oh, pues claro que es una oferta espantosa!

String: But by the time this is over, you might|just wish you’d taken it...
String_di: Pero cuando esto haya acabado, puede|que te arrepientas por no haberla aceptado...

String: Our next contestant works hard, plays hard,|and most importantly: tries hard.
String_di: Nuestro próximo concursante trabaja a tope, juega a tope|y lo más importante: lo intenta a tope.

String: Some might say TOO hard?
String_di: Hay quien insinúa que va... ¿DEMASIADO a tope?

String: ...but that’s not our place to judge!
String_di: ... ¡Pero no nos corresponde a nosotros juzgar eso!

String: Instead, let’s give a warm welcome to...

String: ... the Robot!
String_di: ... ¡al robot!

String: Woo! Here we go!
String_di: ¡Guau! ¡Listo para funcionar!

String: Thank you, Lady Luck!
String_di: ¡Gracias, Fortuna!

String: I’m really excited to begin this|journey to a better self!
String_di: ¡Estoy muy emocionado por comenzar este|viaje a una mejor versión de mí mismo!

String: And what do you hope to win?
String_di: ¿Y qué esperas ganar?

String: I want to eliminate my need to sleep.
String_di: Quiero eliminar la necesidad de dormir.

String: ... uh, I'm sorry?
String_di: ... Eh... ¿cómo dices?

String: With an extra eight hours a day, I can|truly become the best 'me' I can be!
String_di: ¡Con ocho horas más al día, puedo alcanzar|realmente mi mejor versión!

String: Why not just play for immortality?
String_di: ¿Y por qué no juegas para conseguir la inmortalidad?

String: Then you’d have all the time in the world.
String_di: Así tendrías todo el tiempo del mundo.

String: All the research shows that personal change is|more sustainable if you start small.
String_di: Todas las investigaciones confirman que el cambio personal|es más sostenible si empiezas poco a poco.

String: I’m gonna try for immortality next time!
String_di: ¡La próxima vez probaré con lo de la inmortalidad!

String: Oh my dear!
String_di: ¡Ay, cielo!

String: There won't be a next time.
String_di: No habrá una próxima vez.

String: Just try to make the most of this one. In you go!
String_di: Así que intenta aprovechar esta al máximo. ¡Ahí lo llevas!

String: BZZZZT! BEEP! It’s our little optimised optimist the Robot!
String_di: ¡BZZZZT! ¡BIP! ¡Es nuestro robotito, tan optimizado y tan optimista!

String: How are the calculations coming along, my dear?
String_di: ¿Cómo van los cálculos, querido?

String: They’re good!
String_di: ¡Todo correcto!

String: Er, I don’t really beep, you know.
String_di: Bueno, yo no soy mucho de bips, ¿sabes?

String: I do know, yes. Still keen to be the|very best version of yourself?
String_di: Claro que lo sé. ¿Todavía sigues empeñado en alcanzar|la mejor versión de ti mismo?

String: Well! Yes!
String_di: ¡Eso sí! ¡Claro!

String: But I was wondering...
String_di: Pero me preguntaba...

String: Since I’ve completed some of my episodes...
String_di: Ya que he completado algunos de mis episodios...

String: Could I maybe leave now and just win, say,|two hours less sleep a night?

String: Oh, what an interesting idea!|Let me have a think...

String: No. No, you obviously can’t.
String_di: No. Obviamente no puedes.

String: Haven’t you been paying any attention at all?
String_di: ¿Es que no has prestado atención todo este tiempo?

String: Get back in the Dungeons, pal-culator.
String_di: Vuelve a las mazmorras, calculadora con patas.

String: Hey! How's the self-improvement going?
String_di: ¡Eh! ¿Cómo va el tema de la autosuperación?

String: Are you the best possible version of yourself yet?
String_di: ¿Ya eres la mejor versión posible de ti mismo?

String: I only want top-quality minions in my dungeons.
String_di: Solo quiero esbirros de la mejor calidad en mis mazmorras.

String: ...not yet! But I’m gonna try harder.
String_di: ... ¡Todavía no! Pero voy a esforzarme más.

String: I’m still going to win.
String_di: Y todavía pienso ganar.

String: Ah, bless your heart. Never give up hope.
String_di: Ay, pobre diablillo. No te des por vencido.

String: Keep believing that this time, THIS|time, it might all be okay...
String_di: Sigue creyendo que esta vez, ESTA|vez, todo podría salir bien...

String: It might!
String_di: ¡Sí que podría!

String: You know what? I think it|will be! I can feel it!
String_di: ¿Sabes qué? ¡Creo que|esta es la buena! ¡Puedo sentirlo!

String: Well, you’d better hope it happens soon - your time’s running |out, so quick, get in there and get fighting...
String_di: Bueno, será mejor que esperes que pase pronto, te estás|quedando sin tiempo. Venga, rápido, entra ahí y pelea...

String: It's time to meet the fourth member of our little squad!
String_di: ¡Ha llegado la hora de conocer al cuarto miembro de nuestra pandilla!

String: What she lacks in attention span, she makes up for in ingenuity.
String_di: Lo que le falta de atención lo suple con ingenuidad.

String: Yes, that's right - it's time for...
String_di: Sí, así es, es el turno de...

String: ... the Inventor!
String_di: ... ¡la inventora!

String: Wait, how did you do that?
String_di: Un momento, ¿cómo has hecho eso?

String: I’m really a dice?
String_di: ¿De verdad soy un dado?

String: Oh wow, my little legs.
String_di: Anda, mira qué piernecitas.

String: This shouldn’t be possible!
String_di: ¡Pero si es imposible!

String: I’m the all-powerful personification of fate,|my dear - everything’s possible.
String_di: everything's possible.

String: Now, what brought you to the Dungeons this evening?
String_di: Bueno, ¿por qué has venido hoy hasta las mazmorras?

String: Oh, we all caught the train together!
String_di: ¡Ah, hemos cogido el tren todos juntos!

String: It was one of the new model T-132s|with the regenerative brakes!
String_di: Era un modelo nuevo, el T-132,|¡con frenos regenerativos!

String: ...I see. Yes.
String_di: ... Ya veo. Sí.

String: But what, my dear, are you hoping to WIN?
String_di: Pero cielo, ¿qué es lo que esperas GANAR?

String: Complete understanding of everything in the universe!
String_di: ¡La compresión absoluta de todas las cosas del universo!

String: ...I can tell we’re going to have a wonderful|time in the Dungeons tonight.
String_di: ... Estoy convencida de que vamos a pasarlo|estupendamente en las mazmorras esta noche.

String: So let’s get started!
String_di: Así que... ¡en marcha!

String: Inventor, my determined little friend.
String_di: Inventora, mi valiente y resuelta amiguita.

String: How are you getting on with my Dungeons?
String_di: ¿Cómo te está yendo en las mazmorras?

String: You know, I’m not 100% sure they’re fair.
String_di: Bueno, no estoy completamente segura de que sean justas.

String: I think some episodes might|be harder than others.
String_di: Creo que algunos episodios podrían ser|un poco más difíciles que otros.

String: Oh gosh! Surely not! How terribly unjust that would be.
String_di: ¡Ay, cielos! ¡Por supuesto que no! Eso sería una enorme injusticia.

String: I must look into it.
String_di: Me aseguraré de comprobarlo.

String: ...and actually...
String_di: ... De hecho...

String: ... the more I think about it the more it seems|like you must have realised already...
String_di: ... cuanto más lo pienso, más me hace pensar|que tú ya has tenido que darte cuenta...

String: I don’t think that can possibly be true, my dear.
String_di: No creo que eso sea cierto, encanto.

String: It doesn’t sound like me at all.
String_di: No me pega para nada.

String: ANYWAY, in you go! Have a great episode!
String_di: ¡EN FIN, vuelve a entrar ahí! ¡Que tengas un episodio estupendo!

String: Don’t get trapped forever!
String_di: ¡No te quedes atrapada para siempre!

String: Welcome back, my little cubeling! It’s so lovely to-
String_di: ¡Bienvenida de nueva, mi pequeña cubitera! Qué agradable tenerte-

String: Nope! Not listening! I’m not interested|in talking to you any more!
String_di: ¡Nanay! ¡Que no te escucho! ¡No tengo intención de seguir|hablando contigo ni un segundo más!

String: But I was about to make you a very|generous offer, my dear.
String_di: Pero si estaba a punto de hacerte|una oferta muy generosa, querida.

String: Are you telling me you’re not interested|in... making a deal?
String_di: ¿Acaso no estás interesada en...|hacer un trato?

String: LA LA LA LA NOT LISTENING!
String_di: ¡LA LA LA LA, NO TE ESCUCHO!

String: You’re a fraud and a cheat and I’m not|going to waste time arguing with you!
String_di: ¡Eres un fraude y una tramposa, y no voy a|malgastar mi tiempo discutiendo contigo!

String: I’m figuring this whole place out|and I’m making a plan...
String_di: Voy a dar con la solución de este sitio|y estoy haciendo un plan...

String: ...so you might as well just put me back|in for another fight RIGHT NOW.
String_di: ... así que ya puedes meterme de nuevo|para la siguiente pelea, AHORA MISMO.

String: ... well, if you insist. You don’t have|much time left, after all.
String_di: ... Bueno, si insistes. Después de todo,|no te queda mucho tiempo.

String: Let’s just try another little twist on the|rules, and see how you like THAT...
String_di: Vamos a probar otra pequeña alteración|de las reglas, a ver si te GUSTA...

String: It’s time to meet our final contestant - an aspiring|vlogger who’s cast a spell over us all!
String_di: an aspiring|vlogger who's cast a spell over us all!

String: Here she is -
String_di: Aquí está...

String: the social media medium –
String_di: la más mediática en las redes sociales...

String: ready to enter the Dungeons as...
String_di: está preparada para entrar en las mazmorras como...

String: ... the Witch!
String_di: ... ¡la bruja!

String: Oh my god, I’m really a dice!
String_di: ¡Santo cielo, sí que soy un dado!

String: Is this a new chat filter?

String: And Lady Luck, I can’t believe I’m|meeting you in person!
String_di: ¡Eres Fortuna! ¡Es increíble|conocerte en persona!

String: Can I get a selfie?

String: There’ll be plenty of time for that later,|my little flatterer.
String_di: Tendremos muchísimo tiempo para eso más tarde,|querida admiradora.

String: Now, what has lured you to my realms of mystery?
String_di: Pero antes dime: ¿qué te ha atraído|hasta mis misteriosos reinos?

String: Honestly, I’m just SO happy to be here.
String_di: Pues la verdad que estoy MUY contenta de estar aquí.

String: I’m super excited to go wherever fate takes me!
String_di: ¡Me muero de ganas por ir adonde me depare el destino!

String: You know that if you don’t ask for something specific,|you won’t get a prize, even if you win?
String_di: ¿Sabes que tienes pedir algo en concreto|o no recibirás ningún premio, incluso si ganas?
... ¡Anda!

String: Hmm, in that case how about...|ten million followers.
String_di: Mmm, en ese caso qué te parece si pido...|diez millones de seguidores.

String: Real ones too, not bots this time...
String_di: Y que sean de verdad esta vez, nada de bots...

String: That’s more like it. Now let’s play!
String_di: Eso está mejor. ¡Que empiece el juego!

String: My wonderful Witch! How have you been|enjoying your time in the Dungeons?
String_di: ¡Mi maravillosa bruja! ¿Estás disfrutando de tu paso|por las mazmorras?

String: Too easy, perhaps? Maybe I'll crank up the difficulty.
String_di: ¿Está siendo demasiado fácil, quizás? Podría subir la dificultad.

String: It’s okay. I can do this.
String_di: Me vale. Puedo hacerlo.

String: It’ll be fine! It’ll all be fine.
String_di: ¡Todo va a salir bien! Todo saldrá a pedir de boca.

String: That's the spirit, my dear!
String_di: ¡Así se habla, encanto!

String: That can-do attitude is why you're my favourite.
String_di: Por eso eres mi favorita, por tu actitud positiva ante todo.

String: Of course, you’re all doomed in the long run...
String_di: Aunque obviamente todos estáis condenados a la larga...

String: It’s.. it’s all about the journey, right?
String_di: Lo que... lo que más importa es el viaje, ¿verdad?

String: And I’m just so humbled by the support at home.
String_di: Y estoy abrumada por el apoyo que recibo.

String: I *am* supported at home, right?
String_di: Porque la gente me apoya, ¿no?

String: The audience likes me?
String_di: ¿A la audiencia le caigo bien?

String: Not all of them, my dear.
String_di: No a todos, cielo.

String: Honestly, you’re a bit of a divisive figure.
String_di: Lo cierto es que eres una figura que causa división de opiniones.

String: But maybe you can win them over|now if you try hard enough!
String_di: ¡Pero quizás puedas convencerlos|ahora si te esfuerzas lo suficiente!

String: Ah, my lovely little witch.
String_di: Ah, mi encantadora brujita.

String: Your friends are getting close to giving up, you know.
String_di: Tus amigos están más cerca de rendirse, para tu información.

String: But I'll tell you what - if you quit first, I won't make|you fight the next round of contestants.
String_di: ¿Pero qué te parece esto? Si te rindes antes, no te obligaré|a luchar en la siguiente ronda de concursantes.

String: I'll let you have a go as the Dicey Dungeons|social media intern instead.
String_di: Y en su lugar te dejaré ser la nueva becaria|de redes sociales de Dicey Dungeons.

String: You know what, you can just go and-
String_di: Mira lo que te digo, puedes irte a...

String: No swearing, my dear! Remember - we're on television.
String_di: ¡Nada de palabras soeces, querida! Recuerda: estamos en la tele.

String: ...go and make other recruitment arrangements,|because I'm not doing anything for you. Ever.
String_di: ... irte a buscar tratos con otros,|porque yo no voy a hacer nada por ti. Nunca.

String: And when I get out, I'm gonna tell|everyone just how evil you are!
String_di: ¡Y cuando salga de aquí, les contaré|a todos lo mala que eres!

String: 'When you get out...’?
String_di: ¿Cuando salgas de aquí...?

String: Every time I think you start to understand your situation,|you make it clear that you really, really don't.
String_di: Cada vez que creo que empiezas a entender tu situación,|me dejas más claro que no entiendes nada de nada.

String: Well, maybe another fight or two will|help to clear it up...
String_di: Bueno, quizá un par de peleas más|te ayuden a ver las cosas con claridad...

String: ... You.
After all these years. How could you? How *dare* you?
String_di: Después de todos estos años. ¿Cómo has podido? ¿Cómo te atreves?

String: I’ve been down here so long!
String_di: ¡Llevo aquí abajo muchísimo tiempo!

String: I just want to breathe fresh air and eat a|pizza and go on a rollercoaster and--
String_di: Solo quiero respirar aire fresco, comerme una pizza,|subirme a una montaña rusa y-

String: Silence! That was a rhetorical question, minion.
String_di: ¡Silencio! Era una pregunta retórica, esbirro.

String: Plus I’m sick of being called a minion!
String_di: ¡Y además estoy harto de que me llamen esbirro!

String: Decades in the dungeon, working day and night,|and I’m still not even a sidekick?
String_di: Tras décadas en la mazmorra trabajando día y noche,|¿ni siquiera soy un secuaz?

String: So you'd prefer to try your hand as a CONTESTANT?
String_di: ¿Así que prefieres probar suerte como CONCURSANTE?

String: Well, good luck with that!
String_di: ¡Vale, pues buena suerte con ello!

String: AND IN CASE IT WASN'T CLEAR, THAT WAS SARCASM.
String_di: Y POR SI NO ESTABA CLARO, ESTOY SIENDO SARCÁSTICA.

String: I HOPE YOU HAVE THE MOST MISERABLE EXPERIENCE OF ALL.
String_di: ESPERO QUE TENGAS LA EXPERIENCIA MÁS MISERABLE POSIBLE.

String: It can’t be as miserable as working for you!
String_di: ¡No puede llegar a ser tan miserable como trabajar para ti!

String: Let’s go!
String_di: ¡Vamos allá!

String: Oh, it’s you again.
String_di: Oh, tú otra vez.

String: How’s the despair going?
String_di: ¿Cómo te va lo de perder la esperanza?

String: What about the sickening waves of regret?
String_di: ¿Y los repugnantes sentimientos de arrepentimiento?

String: Pretty much under control, to be honest!
String_di: ¡Si te digo la verdad, lo tengo todo bajo control!

String: You know this is going to end terribly.
String_di: Sabes que esto va a acabar de forma pésima.

String: I was already trapped for eternity!
String_di: ¡Ya estaba atrapado para toda la eternidad!

String: That *is* ending terribly!
String_di: ¡Eso sí que es acabar de forma pésima!

String: Well, next time round you won’t have a cushy job in|the introductions and razzle-dazzle department.
String_di: Bueno, la próxima vez no tendrás un trabajo cómodo|en las presentaciones y el departamento de estramboticidades.

String: You’ll be down on level one, hanging out with the frog|and that unbearable space guy. ALL DAY, EVERY DAY.
String_di: Estarás allí abajo, en el nivel uno, acompañando a la rana|y a ese tío espacial insoportable. HORA TRAS HORA, DÍA TRAS DÍA.

String: You know what they say - a change|is as good as a holiday!
String_di: Ya sabes lo que dicen:|¡El tiempo todo lo cambia!

String: Well, you should enjoy this CHANGE I’m|making to the rules, then! IN YOU GO...
String_di: Bueno, ¡pues a ver si disfrutas de este CAMBIO|que voy a hacer en las reglas, listillo! PARA ADENTRO...

String: Well, let’s all fall silent for the Jester once again.
String_di: Bueno, vamos a quedarnos todos en silencio|ante el bufón una vez más.

String: And let's ignore how pleased with themselves they look.
String_di: Y también vamos a ignorar lo mucho|que se gusta a sí mismo.

String: I’m a jester. I’m always pleased with myself.
String_di: Soy un bufón. Siempre estoy contento conmigo mismo.

String: I’d expect you of all people to know|how likely it is that you’ll fail...
String_di: Esperaba que tú antes que nadie supiera|que lo más probable es que todos fracaséis...

String: ...how improbable it is that you and your new|pals can thwart fate and chance and entropy.
String_di: ... Que vieras que es casi imposible que tú y tus|nuevos amigos evitarais el destino, la mala suerte y la entropía.

String: Still, better to try anyway, right?
String_di: Bueno, pero es mejor intentarlo igualmente, ¿no?

String: And if it doesn’t work this|time, we'll try again.
String_di: Y si no lo conseguimos esta vez,|lo intentaremos otra vez.

String: And again. And again.
String_di: Y otra. Y otra.

String: Until it does.
String_di: Hasta que lo consigamos.

String: Yes, people say the same thing about the lottery, I believe.
String_di: Sí, creo que la gente dice lo mismo sobre la lotería.

String: You should really know better, after all this time.
String_di: Después de todo este tiempo, deberías saberlo.

String: But I suppose you don’t have any other options.
String_di: Pero supongo que no tienes ninguna otra opción.

String: So, in you go!
String_di: ¡Venga, adentro!

String: A customer! How exciting! We've got some absolute|bargains for you today!
String_di: ¡Clientes! ¡Qué emoción! ¡Hoy tenemos gangas|buenísimas para ti!

String: Come in! Yolanda's got some amazing products in stock today!|Yolanda's also speaking in the third person again - oops!
String_di: ¡Adelante! ¡Yolanda tiene unos productos estupendos hoy!|Yolanda también está hablando otra vez en tercera persona... ¡Ups!

String: What are you after? Something shiny, something swooshy, something|that seems useful but isn't? We've got ‘em all!
String_di: ¿Qué es lo que buscas? ¿Algo brillante, algo chuli? ¿Algo|que parece útil pero que no lo es? ¡Tenemos de todo!

String: Ah you've just missed out on an amazing little beret.|But we've got plenty of other options in stock!
String_di: Vaya, te acabas de perder una boina estupendísima.|¡Pero tenemos muchas más opciones en el almacén!

String: Have a look around! I just sold the last waffle maker,|but maybe something else will take your fancy?
String_di: ¡Echa un vistazo! Acabo de vender la última gofrera, pero puede|que tenga alguna otra cosa por aquí que te guste...

String: Oh we've just had a delivery of some *very* stylish|scarves - no? Just the fighting stuff? Fair enough!
String_di: Ah, nos acaba de llegar una entrega con unas bufandas|muy estilosas. ¿Cómo dices? ¿Que no? ¿Que solo quieres cosas para pelear? ¡Muy bien!

String: Can I tempt you with some wooden spoons? An ice-making|machine? No? Wow, you're one single-minded shopper!
String_di: ¿Puedo ofrecerte unas tentadoras cucharas de madera? ¿Y una|máquina de hielo? ¿No? ¡Vaya, tienes claros tus hábitos de compra!

String: Been saving up your gold pieces? Well, you can't take ‘em|with you! Might as well splurge while you can!
String_di: ¿Has estado ahorrando monedas de oro? Bueno, ¡no puedes|llevártelas! ¡Lo mejor será despilfarrar mientras puedas!

String: Hey there! What do you fancy? I'd offer a discount but|honestly the sales targets down here are INTENSE.
String_di: ¡Buenas! ¿Te llama la atención algo? Te ofrecería un descuento, pero|la verdad es que los objetivos de venta son DUROS por aquí.

String: So good to see you! Come in, come in! Did you sign|up to our loyalty card scheme yet?
String_di: ¡Qué alegría verte! ¡Pasa, pasa! ¿Ya tienes|nuestra tarjeta de cliente habitual?

String: Need a carrier bag? Oh! You brought a backpack? That's|well prepared AND environmentally friendly!
String_di: ¿Necesitas una bolsa? ¡Ah! ¿Has traído una mochila? ¡Vienes|bien preparado Y ayudas al medioambiente!

String: We've just had a delivery of fresh carrots from the Gardener! Great for helping|you see down here! What? The show's well lit? Maybe next time then!
String_di: ¡El Jardinejo nos acaba de dejar un pedido con zanahorias recién cogidas! ¡Te irán de lujo|para ver allí abajo! ¿Cómo? ¿Que está bien iluminado? ¡Bueno, quizá en otra ocasión!

String: I've been working on a new slogan for the shop: “Spend your coins|here - there's literally nowhere else!” What do you think?
String_di: He estado trabajando en un eslogan nuevo para la tienda: “Gástate las|monedas aquí... ¡porque no hay más tiendas!” ¿Qué te parece?

String: I'm so glad to see you! I'm stuck on a crossword clue.|"Underground prison", 7 letters starting with D. Any idea?
String_di: ¡Qué alegría verte! Estoy atascado con el crucigrama.|"Prisión subterránea", 8 letras y empieza por M. ¿Se te ocurre?

String: Oh! You're just in time! I'm about to unveil our new cheese|counter - care for a sample? It's.... un-BRIE-lievable!
String_di: ¡Ah! ¡Justo a tiempo! Estoy a punto de estrenar nuestro nuevo|mostrador de quesos. ¿Quieres probar algo? ¡Un buen queso es fund-emmental!

String: I *love* your energy and determination! Ever|considered opening a shop of your own?
String_di: ¡Me encanta tu energía y tu actitud! ¿Has pensado|en abrir una tienda por tu cuenta?

String: Welcome back! Take your time - I only want satisfied customers.|As my old nan used to say: second place is for losers!
String_di: ¡Hola de nuevo! Tómate tu tiempo, me gusta que el cliente se vaya|contento. Como decía mi abuela: ¡Nadie se acuerda del segundón!

String: It's so nice to see you! Here, I set aside a few bits|and pieces I thought you might like...
String_di: ¡Es un placer verte por aquí! Mira, te he guardado|unas cosillas que podrían interesarte...

String: Hello there! Thinking of settling down in the dungeons yet? Well,|I'll keep this microwave by in case you change your mind!
String_di: ¡Saludos! ¿Te has pensado lo de instalarte en las mazmorras? Bueno,|¡te guardo este microondas por si cambias de idea!

String: Back for more weapons? Not interested in an engraved fountain|pen? Well, I guess the customer is always right!
String_di: ¿Has venido a por más armas? ¿No te interesa una pluma|estilográfica grabada? Bueno, ¡dicen que el cliente siempre tiene la razón!

String: Hey, friend! Is it okay if I call you that? I'm beginning|to feel like we know each other pretty well!
String_di: ¡Hola, camarada! Puedo llamarte así, ¿no? ¡Empiezo|a sentir que nos conocemos muy bien!

String: Welcome back! Have a browse, have a wander,|let me know if you have any questions...
String_di: ¡Hola otra vez! Mira lo que quieras, date una|vuelta y avísame si necesitas algo...

String: It's just wonderful to see you and your buddies so determined to|fight! It's like you don't know you're hopelessly doomed!
String_di: ¡Es genial ver lo implicados que estáis tú y tus amigos en el|combate! ¡Casi parece que no sabéis que estáis condenados sin remedio!

String: Hey, just so you know, I set a carpet aside for when you all|decide to settle down and make yourselves home round here!
String_di: ¡Que sepas que te he guardado una alfombra para cuando|decidáis asentaros aquí y queráis sentiros como en casa!

String: Oh, hello again! Want to know why my Dungeon shop is so successful?|The overheads are really low! Ahahahahaha!
String_di: ¡Anda, hola! ¿Quieres saber por qué mi tienda en la mazmorra va tan bien?|¡Porque los gastos son muy bajos! ¡Ja, ja, ja, ja, ja!

String: Here's what I've got. Take it or leave it.
String_di: Esto es lo que tengo. O lo tomas o lo dejas.

String: Here are your options! Sorry: here is your option!
String_di: ¡Estás son tus opciones! Disculpa: ¡esta es tu opción!

String: Afternoon. Not much in today.
String_di: Buenas. Hoy no hay mucho.

String: Well, I'll make an offer. No promises that you'll like it.
String_di: Bueno, te haré una oferta. No te prometo que te vaya a gustar.

String: Welcome to the One Swap Shop. Here's today's swap.
String_di: Gracias por venir a la tienda Intercambio Único. El cambio de hoy es...

String: Trading time? Well, see what you think. It doesn't bother me either way.
String_di: ¿Quieres intercambiar algo? A ver lo que opinas. A mí me da igual de todas formas.

String: Well, let's see whether there's anything I can take off your hands.
String_di: Venga, a ver si hay algo que pueda quitarte de las manos.

String: This is all you've got to trade? You're in more trouble than I thought
String_di: ¿Eso es todo lo que tienes para ofrecer? Tienes más problemas de los que pensaba.

String: Your cash is useless here. It's tradeables or nothing.
String_di: Tu dinero no sirve de nada aquí. O trueque o nada.

String: No takey backsies.
String_di: Lo que se da no se quita.

String: Well, I guess this isn't too bloodstained. Want to trade?
String_di: Bueno, tampoco tiene muchas manchas de sangre. ¿Aceptas el trueque?

String: You want more choice? Friend, you're lucky I found one|piece of treasure in your bag of trash.
String_di: ¿Quieres más variedad? Colega, tienes suerte de que haya|encontrado un pequeño tesoro en esa mochila con basura.

String: Here's what I've got - don't expect me to tell you how to use it.
String_di: Esto es lo que tengo. No esperes que te cuente cómo se usa.

String: Oh, it's you. What've you got for me this time?
String_di: Ah, eres tú. ¿Qué tienes para mí ahora?

String: Hope you've brought me something decent this time.
String_di: Espero que esta vez me hayas traído algo decente.

String: You again? What've you got?
String_di: ¿Otra vez tú? ¿Qué tienes?

String: I hope you've got a better haul this time.
String_di: Espero que esta vez tengas mejor material.

String: I hope this works out for you all. But like they say: you should|never go into business or dungeons with your friends.
String_di: Espero que salgáis todos de esta. Pero ya sabes lo que dicen:|Es mejor no meterse en negocios ni en mazmorras con amigos.

String: Look, I like you. Well, I only really like my sister, but I|don't *dislike* you. So I'll make you the best offer I can.
String_di: Mira, me caes bien. Bueno, solo me cae bien mi hermana, pero|NO me caes mal. Así que te haré la mejor oferta posible.

String: Back again? Well, let's get on with it.
String_di: ¿Has vuelto? Venga, vamos al lío.

String: Still down here? I can't decide if you're brave or deluded. Maybe both.
String_di: ¿Sigues aquí abajo? No sé si es por tu valentía o tu ingenuidad. Quizá las dos cosas.

String: How do you still have this much energy? It's|exhausting just dealing with you.
String_di: ¿Cómo sigues con tanta energía? Tratar|contigo ya es agotador.

String: That's your current loadout? Ugh. Maybe this will help|you fail slightly less.
String_di: ¿Esto es lo que llevas encima? Uf. Quizá con esto|no fracases tan estrepitosamente.

String: Huh. I thought you'd be back.
String_di: Je. Imaginaba que volverías.

String: Weren't you just here? Well, the offer still stands.
String_di: ¿No has estado aquí hace un segundo? Bueno, la oferta sigue en pie.

String: Look, take the deal or don't, doesn't bother me. Just don't|keep coming back every five minutes to hum and haw over it.
String_di: Mira, o aceptas el trato, o no, pero no molestes. Deja ya|de volver cada cinco minutos y pasear tus dudas por aquí.

String: You again? Well, I'm not gonna offer you anything different this time.
String_di: ¿Otra vez tú? Bueno, esta vez no voy a ofrecerte nada distinto.

String: I don't haggle, you know. The deal is the deal. Take it or leave it.
String_di: Yo no regateo, para que lo sepas. El trato es el que había. Lo tomas o lo dejas.

String: Do you think if you keep coming back I might offer you more?|Ha. You're lucky I'm not offering less.
String_di: ¿Crees que por volver una y otra vez voy a ofrecerte más?|Ja. Tienes suerte de que no te ofrezca mucho menos.

String: Mate! Come on in! Want a carrot? The Gardener|just dropped by and gave me a few - delicious!
String_di: ¡Colega! ¡Adelante! ¿Quieres una zanahoria? ¡Acaba|de pasar el Jardinejo y me ha dejado unas cuantas riquísimas!

String: Hey! Mate! Come on in! You picked a great time|to come by, the Vacuum was just around for tea|so it's super clean in here at the mo.
String_di: ¡Eh! ¡Colega! ¡Adelante! Qué buen momento|para pasarte

String: Come in! Take a seat! Picked up some great|wiring from Robobot this morning, I reckon|I've got some pretty decent upgrades to offer.
String_di: ¡Adelante! ¡Toma asiento! Me ha llegado un|cableado buenísimo esta mañana de RoboBot. Puedo|ofrecerte unas cuantas mejoras bastante decentes.

String: Heyyy, come in! Tell me: what do you want in|an upgrade? More compact machinery?|More power? More flexibility?
String_di: ¡Buenasss, pasa! Dime, ¿qué es lo que buscas en|una mejora? ¿Maquinaria más compacta?|¿Más potencia? ¿Flexibilidad?

String: Hey! Come in! I love your outfit, you look|really intentional. Have you met Rose yet? So|dapper, I reckon you'd really get on.
String_di: ¡Hola! ¡Adelante! Me encanta lo que llevas, menudo|estilazo. ¿Has conocido ya a Rosa? Es muy|elegante, creo que os levaríais muy bien.

String: Oh you're back! Amazing! I've got some great|upgrades for you, just great, got some amazing|ideas from the Magician.
String_di: ¡Anda, has vuelto! ¡Impresionante! Tengo unas mejoras|estupendas para ti, de verdad, el mago me ha|dado unas ideas buenísimas.

String: Come in! Come in! So good to see you! You just|missed Cornelius! Ah, love that guy, such a joker.
String_di: ¡Adelante! ¡Adelante! ¡Me alegra verte! ¡Cornelius|se acaba de ir! El tío es un guasón, me encanta.

String: Hiya! Hey, want to buy some cookies? Madison|left ‘em here - you know Madison, right?|Great kid, great kid.
String_di: ¡Eo! Oye, ¿quieres comprar galletas? Madison|las ha dejado aquí... Sabes quién es Madison, ¿no?|Qué encanto de niña.

String: Welcome back! It’s so great to see how hard|you’re fighting! Lemme see what I’ve got in|the back, I must be able to help...
String_di: ¡Hola otra vez! ¡Es increíble ver cuánto|estás luchando! A ver qué tengo en la|trastienda, seguro que puedo ayudarte...

String: Mate! You're back! You just missed some|amazing karaoke, you would not BELIEVE how|great the Banshee is once she gets going.
String_di: ¡Colega! ¡Otra vez por aquí! Te has perdido|un karaoke impresionante, ni te IMAGINAS lo|buena que es Banshee cuando le da a un tema.

String: C'mon in! Hey you know the Space Marine? Think|he'd like a telescope for his Dungiversary, or|would it make him sad that he's not in space?
String_di: ¡Entra, adelante! ¿Conoces al Marine espacial? ¿Crees|que le gustaría un telescopio para su mazmorraniversario o|se pondrá triste por no estar en el espacio?

String: I just TOLD you - oh it's you! Sorry, thought|it was Sticky Hands again. Ah he's a good kid|but the shoplifting gets pretty intense!
String_di: No te he DICHO que... ¡Ah, eres tú! Lo siento,|creía que eras Manos pegajosas. Es un buen crío,|¡pero tiene las manos muy largas para los robos!

String: Oh it's you, great. I thought it might be|Marsho - great friend, really great, but that|fire and these chemicals are a tricky mix...
String_di: Ah, eres tú, perfecto. Pensaba que era|Malvavisco... Es un muy buen amigo, pero|su fuego y estas sustancias químicas hacen mala mezcla...

String: Ah come in! Be careful about where you're|walking, just had Slime round for brunch and|I haven't had a chance to mop up yet...
String_di: ¡Ah, pasa! Ten cuidado por donde pisas|porque Limo ha venido a almorzar y no he|tenido tiempo de pasar la fregona aún...

String: Oh it's you, come in! Do you think I could|bosh up a sunlight lamp for Dryad? She's|been a bit down lately.
String_di: ¡Ah, eres tú, pasa! ¿Crees que podría|buscarle una lámpara solar a Dríade? Ha|estado un poco desanimada últimamente.

String: Hey, come in! Stick around if you like, Baby|Squid's coming round - she'd love to see you,|she's always saying you're great to fight.
String_di: ¡Hola, adelante! Quédate si quieres

String: Ah you're still at it! Good on ya, I thought|you'da quit by now! Lemme have a stickybeak|at your equipment and I'll see what I can do.
String_di: ¡Ah, sigues en liza! ¡Bien por ti, pensaba|que te habías rendido ya! Voy a echarle un ojo|a tu equipo y veré lo que puedo hacer.

String: Mate! Come in! I was getting some armour|together for the Cactus. Go easy next time you|two fight, would you? It's hard to be a plant!
String_di: ¡Colega! ¡Adelante! Estaba confeccionando una|armadura para Cactus. No te pases la próxima|vez que luchéis, ¿vale? ¡Ser una planta es duro!

String: Come in! Sorry I'm always yelling that out,|it's just in case you're the Vampire, poor kid|can't come in unless he's invited.
String_di: ¡Adelante! Disculpa que siempre esté gritando eso,|es solo por si se acerca el Vampiro: el pobre|no puede venir si no se le invita.

String: Welcome! Welcome! The book group's meeting in the back - or are you|here for shopping? That's fine, carry on, have a browse!
Hey there! Just window shopping, or are you here to buy?|I've got some bargains in today!
Hey, come on in! Just so you know, we're happy to match any lower prices|you come across... just kidding, we're the only shop in the Dungeons,|so I guess it's take it or leave it!
It's you again! We've just got some new stock in - I hope|there's something we can tempt you with!
Here for some more weapons? We've got a deal on|pool toys - no? The fighting stuff it is, then!
Hi there! It's book group day again, if you're interested? The|Kraken's leading us in a big Tennyson discussion... no? Well, let's|have a look at what we've got in stock!
Hey, come on in! Have a browse! All our stock is battle-ready|and comes with a seven day return policy! Wait, no, sorry,|I misread that - it comes with NO seven day return policy.
It's nice to see you around here so often! Let's have a look at|whether I've got anything that might help you out in these|next few battles...
Hey there, what are you after this time? Just kidding, I know|you only want the fighting stuff! Let's see what we've got...
Welcome! We have some AMAZING deals on jugs and vases,|but I do see it'd be hard to get them out of the dungeons without|breaking! So let's see what we have for battles...
Hi, come on in! And if you want to join in the book group,|they're out the back - Aoife's getting really into the Count of|Monte Cristo...
Cnmonnim! I mean, come in! Sorry, just|snacking on some berries from the|Gardener. What're you after?
Mate, come in! Gimme a sec, I'm|just polishing the Rat King's crown...|he's so humble for a king, isn't he?
Hey, take a seat mate. Don't take it|into the Dungeons though, wouldn't do|you much good there, haha!
Hey, it's you! Come in! Let's get|upgradin'.
Hey there! Just trying to buff up|the Frog's sword, be with you|any minute...
Hey there, mate! What can I do for|you? A polish? An upgrade?
Come on in, come on in! Take a|seat, it's upgrade time!
Come on in! Let's see what you've|got, and what I can do with it...
Hey there! Get your kit out, I reckon|I can do something pretty good today...
Heyyy! Come in, come in! I don't think|we've met? I'm Ned! I'm in charge of|equipment around here.
Oh, a new adventurer! Come on in! Welcome to Dungeon Supplies 4 U - I've|got some great stuff in stock. Need socks? Weapons? A small houseplant?
Hey, this is the trading post. You can trade something here.|If you absolutely insist.
Taking on Lady Luck? All of you? Together? Huh!
Here, take this, it might help.
Can't say I blame you minions for joining in. Working|conditions have been going downhill lately.
Why not shake things up a bit?
What a fun group you are! Hiking around through|the Dungeons like this!
Here, I've got something for you. On the house.
You know what?
I love it here in the Dungeons, but|if you don't...
...maybe you SHOULDN'T actually have to stay|here for all eternity!
I hope you teach Lady Luck a lesson!
Let me get this straight: you're trying to leave the Dungeons,|and you've got the minions to help you.
... You might want this.
Don't tell ANYONE I gave it to you without a trade.
Wow, you bought everything! Good for you! You clearly|know a bargain when you see one!
Oh hey, Alchemist! Wait, no - it's you, huh!|Good on ya! Now let's see what I can do|for those claws...
Oh, you're a bear now? It's a definite improvement.|Can't trade you anything, though.
Come in, come in! You're looking great! Very hairy, very ravenous, it suits you.|But I'm so sorry, I don't think I have anything in your size today.
You can't take this. You're a bear.
Ah look, you've won yet another episode.||Congratulations!#But, oh no! how unexpected!||I've spun the wheel and it doesn't look like|you're taking home a prize this time...

You know, NONE of you contestants have|won your heart's desire yet.||What a baffling stretch of bad luck!||Anyway, it's time for one more|unlucky spin of the wheel...#Oooof, how unfortunate!||Probably next time though, right? Right!
You must think you've been doing SO|well at all this fighting.||So sure, stick with it!||Let's spin the wheel yet again!#Ah, how tragic.||You lose again.

Well, I've got to give you one thing:|you're persistent.||Still thinking about your heart's desire?||Focused on that win?||Then let's set the wheel spinning!#And now let's STOP the wheel on, look|at that, another unfortunate loss...

Ah look, here we are at the wheel again!||Let's give it a spin and see...||...whether this time, THIS time, you|might win your heart's desire.#Nope! Oh well, I'm sure things will look|up for you eventually.
Such a persistent little dice friend!||Sure, let's give the wheel a spin, why not!#No amazing prize this time, I'm afraid.||Bad luck. Maybe it's time to just|give up for ever?
Here to give it another whirl?||Yeah, absolutely!||This could DEFINITELY be the time that|you win your heart's desire!#Oooh, look at that!||What are the chances?

Honestly, what would you even DO with|your heart's desire, if you won it?||No, no, sorry, silly question, let's just|get on with the wheel...#Anyway it looks like you don't need to make|any big decisions about what you would do.||At least not just yet.||Maybe next time!

Congratulations! That was a|magnificent victory!||You've earned another go at winning your|freedom AND your heart's desire!||Leeeeeeet's...||SPIN. SPIN. SPIN. SPIN. SPIN...#Ohhhh, bad luck!||But don't worry - there are plenty more|chances to spin where that came from!
Another magnificent win!||Now, let's wait for THE WHEEL|to do it's thing...#Oh dear.||Looks like THE WHEEL is against you today.||But never mind, maybe next time!

Congratulations! You're on fire!||Not literally, of course – we don't want to|step on the Fireman's toes.||Anyway, let's have another spin|of THE WHEEL!...#Ah, bad luck.||But it looks like you've won a set of lightly|used picnic cutlery as a consolation prize!

Amazing! Astounding!||Now let's see what THE WHEEL has to say...#Ah. It doesn't look like you're getting|everything you've ever wanted yet.||But maybe next time?||And for now you can have this...|fax machine!

And it's time for another visit to the|victory stage!||Let's all hold our breath and think about|all the things you could do with your|heart's desire if you win...#Ah, not this time, but we'll see you soon|for another episode and another chance!

The wheel's been against you before,|but that can't last for ever!||Let's mutter GO GO GO under our breath|while we watch the wheel spin...#Ah, another highly unlikely spin of the|wheel there, but maybe next time!
Surely probability DEMANDS that you'll|triumph this time!||No, don't do the maths, come on,|focus on the wheel...#Oooh, looks like no.||But surely that means that next|time you're BOUND to win...

Time for another spin of the wheel!||Concentrate REALLY HARD on your|heart's desire...||...the thing you want more than anything|else in the world...#Well, looks like you're not going to fulfill|all your hopes and dreams THIS time...||...but we'll see you soon for another episode!

This has been fun, but I know what|you're really here for:||That amazing prize that you're SURELY|going to win this time!||SPIN THE WHEEL! SPIN THE WHEEL!#...oh, BAD luck, friend.||But don't give up!||I believe in you!

Are you having a nice time in the Dungeons?||We're just LOVING having you here!||Although of course what you really want|is to get your prize and get out, so let's|SPIN THE WHEEL...#Ah, such a shame!||But if you stick with it, you're|bound to win eventually!

You've been doing SO well!||Adapting to all the new rules, fighting|all of Lady Luck's minions.||Will it finally pay off?#Oh no, bad luck - wait no..||...the wheel's still spinning, give it a moment...||RIGHT. Yes. Bad luck!
Welcome back to the Victory Stage!||You know the drill - let's give it a|spin and see if you win!#Another near miss - but I admire|your optimism.||That's right! Stick with it!|Never give up!

Well, here we are again!||Let's try the exact same thing we've|been doing for ages...||...and see if the results are|different this time!#Oooof, no, sorry.||But maybe if you try it another|five or ten times...

You're really sticking with this, aren't you?||Not tempted to give up on your dreams?||Okay, then let's spin the wheel!||Who knows what's going to happen|now, it could be literally anything!#And it's ANOTHER IMPLAUSIBLE LOSS,|I'm so sorry!
SPIN! SPIN! SPIN! SPIN!||WIN! WIN! WIN...#Oh, not this time though, bad luck!
We're rooting for you, so let's|SPIN THE WHEEL!#...ah, sad times, but it's so brave|of you to keep trying.||So let's have another episode!

Location: Lady Luck end of episode to Jester
String: Ah, my little traitorous Jester returns.||Sure, let's go pretend this spin|means something.||And here we go...#Another loss.

Location: Lady Luck end of episode to Jester
String: You again!||Let me give this big wheel a spin while I gaze|at you with bottomless malevolence, and|you drop your eyes in shame!#Fancy that! You lose!

Location: Lady Luck end of episode to Jester
String: You know what?||I think I'm going to let the wheel spin fairly this|time, just so that I can feel your agony more|keenly when you lose.#Which you did.||Well, WHAT a shame.

Location: Lady Luck end of episode to Jester
String: Having fun here, my dear?||Fighting your long-term friends|and colleagues?||In a game that you know you'll never win?#And you didn't!

Location: Lady Luck end of episode to Jester
String: It's theoretically possible, of course, that this|wheel is going to spin you up a prize and a path|out of the dungeon.||So let's spin it!||I'm going to enjoy watching your|face as you lose.#Yeah go on, try to hide your despair...

Location: Lady Luck end of episode to Jester
String: Jester! Aren't you doing well!||Of course, you've had SO much practice|fighting in these dungeons.||If you didn't do well you'd be even MORE of|a disappointment than you already are.||Wanna chant a little bit| before we spin?||SPIN THE WHEEL, remember?||SPIN THE WHEEL! SPIN THE WHEEL!#Bad luck, there, buddy. Maybe you|should have chanted harder.

Location: Lady Luck end of episode to Jester
String: Back for another spin?||Of course! Let's see if you win!||Literally anything is possible, and it's not like|anybody involved here has absolute power|over fate and fortune!#Oh wait, no, I absolutely do.||Isn't that nice!

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: You win!||Of course, we don't spin the wheel any more.||But feel free to spin around on the|spot if you'd like.

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Congratulations!||You know, are you ABSOLUTELY SURE|you don't want to be a minion?||I mean, you DO seem to like it here...||No? All right, then!

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Another triumph!||Sometimes I wonder if I made it|too easy for you...

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Magnificent!||Shall we spin the wheel just this once,|for old time's sake?#What was it we used to say?||Ah yes! 'Bad luck there - but maybe|next episode!'.||Ah, good times!

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: A beautiful battle right at the end there - you|always were one of the most elegant fighters|in your little group!||Three cheers and hip hip hooray!

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Oh, well done! Another victory!||Now tell me, how's everything in the|outside world?||How's work? What's the weather like?||Are we ever going to hear the pitter|patter of tiny dice?

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Ah, lovely, a couple of wonderful close|calls in there, my dear.||I'll admit I was lying when I said|you were my favourite...||...but you're at least my SECOND favourite.

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Congratulations! Another win!||Now, do send my best wishes to|the rest of the group...||...and tell them that we're always here if|they want to come back to fight!||Or, y'know, just to pick up a couple of shifts as|minions if they need some extra cash...

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Well done!||And can I just say: it's so nice to see you|and the minions hanging out like this.||Maybe one day we should have a big reunion|picnic, get all you dice down here at once.||I promise I won't trap you|for eternity again...

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Amazing! VERY clever work, there!||Perhaps you could come in and give a guest|lecture to the younger minions some time?

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: SUCH a delight of a fight!||I'll always keep your room ready for|you, you know.||And by 'room' I mean 'six-floor|fighting dungeon'.

Location: Lady Luck end of episode post endgame
String: Ah, I'm beaming with pride again!||I really feel like the quality of your fighting|vindicates my decision to turn you into a|dice and try to trap you here for eternity.||Congratulations!
Congratulations!
Your very first victory!
Am I super strong now?
You’ll ALWAYS be super strong to me.
But also... no, sorry.
How it works is, every time you win|an episode, you get the chance to...
SPIN... THE... WHEEL!
And if the wheel ends up on a star?
You get to leave the Dungeons and|take home your heart’s desire!
Get ready to...
SPIN THE WHEEL!
You’re not chanting...
Oh, sorry! SPIN THE WHEEL!
Here we go...
Ahhhh, bad luck! No prize this time.
But never mind, there are plenty|of episodes to come!
SPIN THE WHEEL! SPIN THE WHEEL!
...you can stop chanting now.
What a sneaky, underhanded victory. Magnificent!
I’m not here for compliments. I’m here for prizes.
Of COURSE you are.
And that means it’s time to...
SPIN THE WHEEL!|SPIN THE WHEEL!
If you land on a prize spot, you’ll get your|billion and a quick pathway out of th...
Got it. Spin.
Wanna do a drum roll to build anticipation?
Just spin it!
...oh, BAD luck! Looks like you|missed out this time.
But don’t lose hope - your time|in the Dungeons isn’t up yet!
We’ll be back soon with|more episodes!
What a wonderful batch of contestants you all are!
And what a beautiful victory!
Thank you! I worked very hard!
I can tell!
Now, fingers crossed as we SPIN THE WHEEL.
Depending on how it lands, you’ll either walk away|with a prize, or we’ll invite you back to join us for|another episode!
Actually I’m going to uncross my fingers|if that’s okay with you?
The wheel’s really heavy and I|need to get a good grip...
That’s okay, I’ve got ALL my fingers and toes crossed.
I know it doesn’t change the outcome of the|spin, but it helps me stay calm!
Well, take a deep breath while the|WHEEL SPINS aaaaaand...
...I’m so sorry!
It looks like you don’t win a life without|sleep - at least, not just yet.
But you DO take home a secret bonus prize:
An expired 50% off voucher for your|local pizza restaurant!
And of course, you’ll get the chance to return|to the Dungeons in another episode...
You’re doing so well! Congratulations!
Welcome to the VICTORY STAGE!
We’re going to SPIN THE WHEEL to see whether|you’ve won yourself a nice little prize -
- what was it you were after again?
I want to have complete understanding of everything in the universe!
Ah, don’t we all?
Right, let’s SPIN THE WHEEL and see...
...nope, it looks like you’re|out of luck this time.
But maybe next episode!
...can you at least tell me how the wheel works? It’s so cool!
Hahaha no I definitely can’t!
CUT. Did anyone hear me? I|said CUT. Stop filming!
What a fight! You were amazing!
Honestly, I just lost myself in the moment.
I forgot I was even on camera - it was all about the|spells and the dice. What a wonderful experience!
Shall we find out whether|you’ve won a prize?
I mean it’s not really about the prize, is it?
But also, yes.
Time to SPIN THE WHEEL!|SPIN THE WHEEL!
If it lands on the PRIZE, then|you get your heart’s desire!
More social media followers, I think?
That’s right! SPIN THE WHEEL! SPIN THE WHEEL!
And ohhhh... bad luck - it|looks like that’s a no!
But don’t you worry - you’ve made it through to|the next episode, and another chance to win.
Ah, my little betrayer of trust! It’s you!
Yep, it’s me!
How does it feel to be on the other|side of the wheel?
Pretty good, actually!
...really?
After all these hundreds of years of|spinning the wheel...
...even you must realise it’s not|going to land on a prize.
I mean, that’s not ideal, but you know what?
Better to be cheated than to be a cheat!
...well, let’s go through the motions.
Will you have a look at that! You lose.
Guess I’ll just have to go and fight in another episode, then.
At least I know I’m on the right side now!
See you soon, minion.
And for eternity.

Location: Jester joins the team – Winning dice
String: ... uhhh

Location: Jester joins the team – Winning dice
String: So, who's going to spin the wheel now?
No idea!
Not my problem anymore!
C'mon, let's get out of here!
...Hey! It’s you! Hey, it’s so|good to see you!
Um, I’m just filling in here but I’m meant to|tell you that I’m going to spin the wheel...
...and then when you lose I’m meant to say|'better luck next time', I think?
Okay! Yes! Here we go!
Better luck next time!
Aaaah! Hello again!|That was great!
Anyway I got it wrong last time and I’m|meant to tell you to spin the wheel...
...and also tell you that it’s DEFINITELY possible|that you might win and it’s not rigged at all!
Okay now I’m meant to say:
'I’m so sorry, not this time, but we’re excited|to see you soon for more Dicey Dungeons.'
Oh wow, that’s even true! I AM excited|to see you soon!
Hi! Hi! It’s me again!
I’m on my second warning here so|let’s make sure I get this right...
I’m meant to say 'SPIN THE WHEEL|TO SEE IF YOU WIN...
...and don’t say anything about it being rigged...
...and don’t read that last bit out loud'.
Does that sound right? I hope so!
I love being able to see you whenever|you win an episode!
Okay now I’m meant to say 'you lose|but sound sympathetic'. Right!
Okay, okay, I’ve got one more chance so|I’m going to be SO careful here.
THE WHEEL IS SPINNING. HAVE YOU WON?
... YOU HAVEN’T WON.
There! Do you think I did okay?
Oh, whoops! Forgot to press the button!
You know, I think I’m getting|the hang of this!

Location: Lady Luck takes over end of episodes
String: I suppose I’m just going to have to|do this myself. Ridiculous.

Location: Lady Luck takes over end of episodes
String: You know the drill: well done blah blah|blah, I’ve spun the wheel...

Location: Lady Luck takes over end of episodes
String: ...but OH LOOK.

Location: Lady Luck takes over end of episodes
String: It seems like you don’t win your|heart’s desire this time.

Location: Lady Luck takes over end of episodes
String: What a shock.
Well, hello, my doomed little dicelings!
Oh no...
Oh yes! Now, what are you doing backstage?
Ready to give up on your dreams and|go into minion training?
We’re leaving! And you|can’t stop us.
She totally can, sorry.
...Yeah, I definitely can.
Or haven’t you been paying attention?
We’ve been paying a|LOT of attention.
We’ve fought through|your dungeons.
We’ve beaten your bosses.
We’ve won EVERY SINGLE EPISODE!
And yet we're still trapped down here thanks|to your rigged WHEEL OF LIES!
You’re a cheat and this game ISN’T FAIR|so we’re going home!
MINIONS! THE DOORS! ENTER LOCKDOWN!
Once the doors are locked, that’s it, we’re|stuck backstage until we give up.
I’m really sorry, friends. But|at least we tried.
No! I’m not giving up!
And I’m not going to stay|BACKSTAGE for ever!
Quick, can anyone make it through|the last door before it closes?
You found us!
You did it! And you brought the minions!
You didn’t give up! I’m|so happy to see you!
Wait, confetti? What’s happening?
Why are those lights flashing?
Because you won, you big silly billy!
You refused to abandon your friends and you put aside your|differences with the minions and you gave up your worldly|desires and you beat me!
...and you’re... you’re not angry?
Oh my dear, no, of course not!
You’ve done BRILLIANTLY.
Gosh, when was the last time we had a real live victory?
Jester darling, can you fetch the records?
No! I’m not your minion any more! And we|don’t have any records anyway!
Oh, hmmm, are you sure?
Tiny pink octopus! Go and see if you can find any records!
I’ve been waiting SO long for someone to actually|win this game, you wouldn’t BELIEVE.
I feel like it would have happened sooner if you hadn’t|MADE THE GAME SO HARD and DIDN’T CHEAT!
But then what would have happened to your|journey of self-realisation?
Now, everyone pose for a photo...
...beaaaauuutiful.
SUCH a magnificent little bundle of fighters.
Come on, one more, I want something to remember|you by when you’re gone!
When we’re gone... So... we’re free to go? All of us?
Of course!
...but I don’t get to be super strong?
No.
And I don’t get my followers?
No. Your prize is self-knowledge, darling, I|thought we’d covered that.
ALSO, I can’t help but notice that|I’m still a giant walking dice?
Yes? And? Is there some sort of problem?
Now, one more big smile! Say cheese!
Okay. Look.
I can deal with having to sleep.
And I’ve kinda gotten used to the dice thing.
But what about the minions? Are they free to go as well?
Yeah, we would never have made it out without them.
Honestly my loves, they’re all very settled here.
They might grumble a little, but they have families and|vegetable gardens and everything.
That’s not the point! They fought with us!
And they won!
...ah, I suppose you’re right. They were VERY brave.
I’ll tell you what, they can leave if they really want to.
And if they don’t then I’ll see if that|employee suggestion box opens.
I miiiiight increase everyone’s holiday leave...
WHAT holiday leave?
From nothing, my dear. I’ll increase it from nothing!
My goodness, can’t you just enjoy your confetti?
...okay. I guess it’s pretty good confetti.
Let’s all give one LAST BIG SMILE and think about the lessons|we’ve learned as we’ve fought so valiantly in these dungeons.
In some cases we fought side by side, and maybe in other cases|we fought in vicious opposition, but the important thing is...
...that we did it together.
Ah, my precious little dice-keteers!
My real live winners!
It’s been SUCH a delight having you here.
Please, PLEASE, do drop by any time.
I absolutely promise I’ll let you leave again.
Now, did we ever make any end credits?
Wait, confetti?
What’s happening?
You refused to abandon your friends!
You put aside your differences with the minions!
... and you gave up your worldly desires and beat me!
No! I’m not your minion any more!
And we don’t have any records anyway!
What a victory!
And may I say, you're looking|extremely dapper there.
Now, shall I spin the wheel?
Ah, bad luck!
Now, let's get you through into the costume department|and have someone pluck all those hairs out.
I see it's time yet again to SPIN THE|WHEEL, or as you might say...
...RRRRAWWRR RAWR RRRAWR.
Ah, BAD luck, you miss out on|a prize yet again.
But then, what would the heart's|desire of a bear even look like?
Maybe it's for the best that|we'll never find out.
Welcome back! It's so great to see how hard|you're fighting! Lemme see what I've got in|the back, I must be able to help...
